application-desc.title: How to use this application
application-desc.text: This application allows you to analyze your codebase based on the number of lines and commits history. To do this, you must first add a git repository. Then, you can analyze it by clicking on the 'Cloc revisions' button on 'codebases' page. You can also upload a custom codebase files tree to display it on the analysis graph.

cloc-revisions.title: Cloc revisions
cloc-revisions.text: This analysis allows you to see on a treemap, the complexity of your codebase based on the number of lines and commits history. The size of the files and folders is proportional to the number of lines of code. The color of the files and folders is proportional to the number of commits. The more commits a file or folder has, the more it tends towards red.
